comment.text: We both really enjoyed this place! The service was a little slow but the staff was friendly. The Blueberry Buck was spot on and the Chocolate Melting Cake was to DIE FOR!! Prices were reasonable. Lots of choices to choose from for both food and drinks. What I loved about it too is that they had a very decent sized Gluten Free menu. Definitely recommend this place if you're looking for that sports bar styled restaurant.

photos.caption: Tavern Burger in a lettuce wrap and the Buffalo Chicken wrap.
Chocolate melting cake with ice cream

owner_replies.comment:
Amanda,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon. Cheers!

comment.text:
My friend and I met for lunch. It was pretty busy. We sat at the bar. Service was initially great, then went a bit downhill. The bartender let favoritism take over and started to prioritize the two white women that came in and sat down, after we had already ordered. By the convo, they knew one another personally or were regulars. While we were waiting on our food, the two women got served drinks AND their food out first. SAME food item, as my friend ordered prior to their arrival... No special cooking instructions.

The alcoholic drinks I had were tasty but for the size vs prices, definitely should have at least another half ounce of liquor added. I had the jumbo crab cake and the asparagus fries. They were delicious! I wouldn't necessarily go back. I need great drinks and I want to not feel like I have to be familiar with the staff, to receive consistent or their best service. To each their own...

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Anisha,

Thank you for your honest review of our tavern. We would like to speak in person about your experience. Please message us your contact information and we will be in touch quickly.

Thank you!

comment.text: Food is fantastic!! Firecracker shrimp is delicious. Staff is amazing. Will definitely be going back.

We are from out of town and wanted somewhere close to eat from our hotel. My boyfriend says the Wagyu burger is one of the best burgers he's ever had... that says a lot. 
Asparagus fries are also delicious, and they have a great Cesar salad!! We visit Atlanta a lot and this will definitely be our new spot.

owner_replies.comment:
Ally,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern and for being a fan! We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon. Cheers!

comment.text:
My husband and I stopped here on our way back home to Ft Lauderdale and Mr. Darren Foley the GM was gracious enough to accommodate our lunch selections with excellent knowledge of the choices of wine and food selections.
We were both glad he reviewed our choices with a big mustached smile...woof!
The food was very fresh and seasoned well. The wine choice he recommended was super. 
As we travel back and forth from our new home in the mountains to Florida this will be a special place to visit for our meal. 
He recommended to us the other owners restaurants in the area that would enjoy.
Cannot say enough about Darrens professional demeanor.
Thank you sir R&R

owner_replies.comment:
Rob,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern and for stopping by while you were in town. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you both again soon! Cheers!

comment.text: Had an amazing meal here. I ordered the Very Veggie Burger with the Chick Pea Fries. The quality of the ingredients used were impeccable and complimented one another. I also did the fondue with the pretzels and it was a pair made for heaven. The smoothness of the fondue would be compared to that of a velvet thanks to the white wine used. Topped with the bread pudding that was a taste of pure delicacy. Loved this experience and can't wait to enjoy it again. On top of it all our server Lauren was phenomenal.

owner_replies.comment:
Sheddrick,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon. Cheers!

comment.text:
Please note: this review is for drinks at the bar only as we did not dine here.

We walked into Marlow's on Friday night around 6pm. The bar was busy but we managed to get two seats. When we sat we were greeted by our bartender Daniel. We ordered a Manhattan and a Greygoose martini. Both were well crafted and poured into a frosty martini glass. The cocktails were delicious...so much so we had to have another round. Oops!

The atmosphere was pleasant and the service was great. Daniel was attentive and even wrote his and his fellow bartender's (his wife) name on a service card for us in the event that we needed them for anything. This was a nice touch.

Although this was our first visit to Marlow's and we did not dine, the great service and delicious cocktails have us wanting to visit again soon.

photos.caption: This service card was a nice touch!

comment.text: My daughter, best friend, and I did a day trip to ATL from Florida. We hopped on yelp to find a local spot, and landed here. The truffle fries were delicious. I had the bbq pork sandwich, and my daughter got the mini cheeseburgers. The chef came out and spoke to us and my daughter specifically- and made our trip! The creme brûlée was also heavenly. We have decided when we come back we need to make Marlow's a required pit stop every time.

owner_replies.comment:
Alexandra,

We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us! Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again when you're back! Cheers!

comment.text: I was literally dying of hunger and was craving their infamous Royale Burger so I decided to pop in and order one. What's the hype about the Royale Burger? Well it's patty is made with Wagyu beef, the most tender, intense, fat marbling meat that's extremely rich in flavor. Then it's topped with cheese, pickles and a crispy bun; the sandwich literally melts in your mouth! BEST BURGER I'VE EVER HAD hands down! There are so many items to choose from and you really can't go wrong no matter what you order! Not much else to say besides go see for yourself! You won't be disappointed!

Had to add Marlowe's back to the rotation for a little Sunday Brunch. Wanted to meet up with a friend and we know Marlowe's has a pretty good Brunch Buffet that is reasonably priced. 
Arriving toward the beginning of the Brunch period (11:30ish) served us well as there was no wait to be seated. No reservations needed (and I don't believe they are offered for the brunch). 
Parking wasn't an issue as we parked in the parking deck around the corner (towards the highway). It was free parking in the deck. Street parking also available for those lucky enough to find a spot. 
We were seated in a nice comfortable booth; we had our choice of seating based on the availability. 
The buffet had all the right choices. Waffles, french toast, eggs, sausage, bacon, dessert bars, etc. A cook was also available for custom omelet orders. Most everything was delicious. The french toast may have sat a little too long on the heat at a certain point, but that was minor. 
The juice (orange) tasted a little funny as well, but that may have just been the brand. 
Overall good service, good fellowship, and good eats!

photos.caption: Brunch Buffet! One of the best.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Justin,

Thanks so much for your thoughtful four star review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern for brunch. We so appreciate the compliments on the brunch buffet and service from our team! We certainly look forward to serving you again soon! 

Cheers!

comment.text: I so love this place. I've been saying customer service is dead since COVID. No! Our server Zu was so excellent and the food was high quality. I am definitely coming back and I certainly will recommend this restaurant to all my dear family and friends. I wish I could do 6 stars

Went to Marlow's on a Saturday around 3-ish. It wasn't super crowded but we had to wait to be greeted at the hosted stand. I would say it took about 5 minutes for someone to greet us and seat us at our table. They had to be short staffed or something because it wasn't crowded at all.

I ordered appetizers for my meal. I had the crab and shrimp nachos and the asparagus fries. I'd give the crab and shrimp nachos about a 3 out of 5. They were solid, but I wish the chips were crunchy, they were a bit soggy for my liking. Also, they had globs of cheese on each chip, which was a bit much for me (this is coming from someone who is obsessed with cheese). Also, I'm not the biggest fan of imitation crab meat, so that's another reason I gave it 3 out of 5, but for $10.50 you can't expect real crab lol. It wasn't a bad choice by any means but prob wouldn't get it again. Now the asparagus fries were to die for! They are truly a good alternative to French fries. I wish more restaurants offered this as an option. I definitely suggest that you try these. 

Overall, this is a solid place for a Tavern. If you are in the area and just want decent bar food then this place is more than okay. If you are in a hurry, it may not be the place for you.

While in Atlanta for a workshop we decided to give this place a try for dinner. We were staying at the close by Renaissance hotel, so this was an easy choice. I really liked this place! It had a good level of noise and a good vibe overall. I got the Roast chicken frisco club with a "nice salad" as a side, both tasted great! We also got hummus as appetizer, which we all really liked! Our server was also super polite and helpful, I wish I could remember her name, but she did do her best to make this a great experience. Overall, it was a great experience, give this place a try!

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Amir,

Thanks so much for your five star review. We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern. We appreciate the compliments on the hummus, Frisco club, and salad. We also thank you for the kind words about the service from our team. We certainly look forward to serving you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text:
Marlow's tavern is a fairly chill and busy spot right in the middle of midtown Atlanta. It's located within walking distance of a number of other restaurants, businesses, and residences. We came here with a group of 20 people or so and had a great time. 

We were divided into 2 large tables next to each other, it didn't look like there was any space available that could have fit all of us in 1 table. The waitress came by often to take our food and drink orders and check in on us. Best part is that even with such a large group, we never felt like the waitress dropped the ball or we had to wait excessively for food/drinks.

We had a variety of appetizers, the ones I tried were the buts, chicken wings and the truffled parmesan fries. The chicken wings were good, nothing out of the world but fried well with good flavor (the gorgonzola dip was very delish). The fries were ok, nothing to write home about. The nuts were good, but probably nothing you can't get at a decent grocery store. 

I got the filet, and it was mediocre. It was seasoned well enough and the sauce reduction was good, but it wasn't as tender as I hoped for. The parsnip bread budding was good, and so was the asparagus as well.

Beers were good... came old and delicious so can't go wrong there.

First time here. Would definitely recommend. My daughters (all 3 adults) were in Atl. for something else and had time to spare. They found this place and I'm so glad they did. Best food I've had in a long time. We were treated with complimentary JT Chips. Made in house chips were so good. I got the black and blue burger (love these). However this one was made with Gorgonzola cheese (never had before) simply amazing. The burger was cooked to perfection with slight charring around the edge. My side was jumbo asparagus, they weren't literally jumbo but I didn't mind because they were delicious and cooked just right. The manager also gave up complimentary creme brûlée (never had before) it too was amazing. I cannot rave about this place or our food enough. Our server was ok (I've been in the food service industry over 30+ years) she wasn't bad she was very nice and sweet just needs more experience and confidence. The guy that sat us personality 10+, I think the chef (wearing white chef coat) brought us our appetizer and I seen him bussing a table that won major points with me. The manager that prebussed my table also very nice and seemed genuinely happy we had a great experience. I wish I could give this place more stars. Will definitely go back when in the area.
After waiting for our rental at the airport all we wanted to do is eat. So happy we went to grab some food at Marlow's. Cold beer and quick service!!

owner_replies.comment:
Susana,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon. Cheers!

comment.text: Excellent food and service. Because we were new to Marlow's they brought out a free appetizer which was such a nice touch. My son said his filet was very good and the wings I had were great.

owner_replies.comment:
Lori, 

We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your first visit with us. Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon. Cheers!

comment.text:
Always a delightful dining experience!

For starters, the artichoke and arugula toast is delicious! (They change their menu very often so hopefully you'll get a taste..) if not you can always go with the asparagus fries which I hope will alllllways remain on the menu! That's always a treat!

I usually get the tavern salad and make a special request for a medium temp blackened salmon on top. That is thee best salad, but today I went a different route and got the black n blue burger! 
Which was a great choice! Very satisfying and well cooked (Med temp). Very flavorful!

My guests ordered the shrimp and grits and Atlantic salmon, both very delicious! 

Satisfied customers at Marlows, per usual.

I was starving, having missed breakfast and lunch so I rolled up to Marlow's and had their Shrimp and Grits.  It was fantastic - I cleaned the plate!  Heading back today for happy hour!  

#LoveMeSomeMarlows!

Enjoy!

owner_replies.comment:
Patrick,

Thanks so much for the kind review of our tavern and for being a fan! We so appreciate it and look forward to serving you again soon! Cheers!

comment.text: Got a black & blue burger. Service was awesome. Fries were terrific. Got a medium rare burger that was well done. Nice atmosphere & environment

owner_replies.comment:
Ben,

Thank you for the review of our tavern! While we are happy to hear that your service and fries were great, we apologize about the burger. We would like to speak in person about your visit. If you will please send us your preferred contact info to kaylac@metzcorp.com, we will be in touch there. Thanks in advance.

comment.text:
found this place on my last night in the A.
so glad i did.... got there just before the evening rush. I wondered if the lights were usually that dim....or was it the Halloween spirit as the decorations were already hanging and such.  being seated right away looking over the menu and deciding to have small bites to eat. went for the appetizers. Tuna poke/truffle fries/fried Shrimp/crab shrimp nacho.
I know you're thinking 1 person did not eat all that ...lol but yes I did bc i was sharing it so I technically ate and sampled it all lol everything was excellet taste wise....but the crab shrimp nacho was more like a quesadilla  and a little too cheesy for my liking I had a blood orange margarita that I enjoyed also. When in the A. this is definitely a place I will consider going to again

Good experience on a later Saturday night.  Service was top  notch.  Food was superb.  Filet was on point.  Fish tacos. Burger.  Not to mention the appetizers...fire shrimp, tuna poke, fried asparagus.  And fairly priced.  
STRONGLY RECOMMEND!

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Arthur,

Thanks so much for the kind words and review of our Tavern. It is certainly appreciated and we are so glad that you enjoyed your visit! We look forward to serving you again soon. 

Cheers!

comment.text: My sister & I love this spot! Free parking deck is a plus here in Midtown. My favorite is the black and blue burger. Try mixing mayo with black pepper as a dip for your fries. Sounds weird but it's so good! Also their blue lemonade is really good.

While we tend to visit the John's Creek and Avalon locations more often than this midtown, the consistency within the Marlow's chain is just incredible.  Particularly their wait staff.  Always expertly trained and professional, they ensure that they let the food steal the show as they go about their business.  As always the fish tacos ate fantastic, as is any burger you may want to try.  They are taking a break on the new menu from the brie and pretzels, but when it comes back you HAVE to try them.
Marlow's why you do me like this. A side of aparagus is 4 measly sticks of asparagus?? Tried to be healthy but now I want my fries lol

We went to Marlow's Tavern on our way back from a long day at the office!  Sure glad we did!  Service was excellent, thank you Graham!  We had a few brews and decided to grab dinner.  Graham recommended the royal burger and it was fantastic! It was a bit pricy, $7.50 for a craft beer but the beer was excellent!  What really made me give this fine place 5 stars was the outstanding service from Graham and the rest of the staff!  They truly made you feel welcome.  Oh, did I tell you that the Royal Burger was
The bomb!  See you guys on my next visit to  Atlanta!
Was
Excellent
The most friendly amazing staff! It is a local favorite from my understanding but I came by myself from out of town on business - great drinks even better food! Definitely want to come back!

owner_replies.comment:
Katy,

Thanks so much for your review of our tavern. We are thrilled to hear that you enjoyed your visit with us and we look forward to serving you again when you're back in town.

Cheers!

comment.text: We went here for dinner on Saturday night and it exceeded our expectations. The beers were perfectly ice cold and they had a great selection. Our waiter let us do half and half for the fries (half Parmesan truffle half regular) which we really appreciated. I had the chicken panini which was delicious. The bread that they used was fabulous. My boyfriend ordered the Blake and bleu burger and he absolutely loved it. The service was fantastic and we had an overall fabulous night here!

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Rachel,

Thanks so much for your five star review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern. We so appreciate the compliments on the fries, chicken panini and black & bleu burger. Thank you also for the kind words on the service form our team. We certainly look forward to serving you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text: Right on West Peachtree in midtown, this place is a hidden gem in midtown. The service is quick and food is pretty good too, this is right around the publix plaza. Plenty of parking as well and price wise they're like $10-15 lunch for one person. It can get very busy during lunch hours so if you have more than 5 people I suggest you reserve.

Delicious food and top-notch service! Great beer menu with reasonable prices and served with chilled glasses. I went for the black and bleu burger and was not disappointed. Highly recommend either the small Caesar or the truffle Parmesan fries for your side!  Will definitely be back.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Blake,

Thanks so much for your five star review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern. We so appreciate the compliments on the Black & Bleu Burger, Caesar salad and Truffle Parmesan Fries. We also appreciate the kind words on the service from our team. We certainly hope to serve you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text:
Placed a to-go order and waited 30 minutes for buns on a burger that was not edible. Literally hard and burnt. Meat was overcooked. Wings were cold. I was in disbelief at this quality.

Giving 2 stars and not 1 star since the manager on duty (4/21) redid the order after we came back to the restaurant to showed him the pieces of bricks he gave us. Can't say I will come back after this experience.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear J.C.,

Our sincere apologies for your disappointing visit to our tavern. Certainly not the Marlow's way! We would like to speak in person about your experience. Please message us your contact information and we will be in touch quickly.

Thank you in advance!

comment.text: Georgia native.. first visit to Marlow's. Ordered a Georgia Peach Margarita, Tavern Wings, Shrimp and Crab "nachos" and Parmesan truffle fries. Our server, Remi, was phenomenal, attentive and very knowledgeable of the dishes. We had the pleasure of having our dishes delivered by the Chef himself, very pleasant and admitted that he makes his food with passion not love. Passion's stronger . Now for THE FOOD!!! Amazing, delicious. The food was light but the flavors were bold and intense. Everything was the right temperature. The twang of the truffle fries was the perfect complement to the cheesy, slow burn of the Shrimp and Crab Nachos and the elevated flavors of the Tavern Wings. It's the thing you can't put your finger on that makes Marlow's a gem

photos.caption: Crab and Shrimp Nachos, Tavern Wings, Parmesan Truffle Fries

owner_replies.comment:
Seneca,

We are so glad that your first trip into our Tavern was a great one! Thanks so much for the kind words and review of our tavern. We certainly appreciate it and are so glad that you find us as a gem! We look forward to serving you again soon. 

Cheers!

comment.text: Cool trendy swanky bar in Midtown Atlanta. Nice ambiance and Tv's everywhere. I love sitting at the bar so hubby and I spotted to seats to our luck, it's pretty packed. They have several bathrooms near the entrance private bathrooms and m/w single bathrooms (about 5). We ordered 2 glasses of Pinot noir and to our surprise.... it was a bit too cold for my taste. Reds should be room temperature but the bartender was insistent it was proper temp. No problem we're watching the game so I'll sip slow and it will soon be room temp. We decided to order an app and the Ahi sounded appetizing so we went with that... what a great choice!! It was delicious! The ahi was chunky and the Hawaiian sauce was delish. The crispy wontons definitely complemented it well. Satisfied customer

My wife and I first went to Marlow's Tavern during our first trip to Atlanta.  We were in town to find an apartment for our upcoming move.  We sat at the bar and chatted with the friendly bartenders.  The food was delicious... maybe we should live nearby?   We would never have guessed (and didn't find out until we moved the following year) that Marlow's is a local chain.  It really does feel like a local gem.  

Since we moved down, we've made Marlow's our go-to place.  The bartenders are all really friendly.  We'll typically start with the buffalo wings, which are really great.  Sometimes we'll have the smoked trout dip which is very good too.  We rotate through all the different sandwiches which are ALWAYS amazing.  The Royal burger is also a winner.  We rarely venture to the "mains" section but we've really enjoyed the shrimp and grits.  

Overall, Marlow's is a friendly neighborhood restaurant that does it right.
Great atmosphere and service! We are there back to back nights and enjoyed everything!! The hamburgers are like you've never had before! The ahi tuna is a must! We will be back.

First timers.  Sat outdoors in fabulous weather (not that they controlled the weather).   Our cocktails were amazing, and we had a great summery drink - the Gin Job.   The house made potato chips with Gorgonzola cream sauce were to die for.  For entrees, had the fish tacos,  and their featured flat bread (an extraordinary Cajun concoction!).   Both were flavorful, fresh, and just all around superb.   The jalapeño grits were excellent - this from a yankee who doesn't generally care for grits.  

The service was exemplary and our server Brandon was amazing.   Would absolutely recommend.   Will definitely come back here.

photos.caption: Fresh made potato chips with Gorgonzola cream sauce - to die for!

comment.text: In the mood for brunch and this is what I ended up with  it was ok! Maneuvering around downtown Atlanta is . The food was good, no complaints there. If you can make it through all the detours, one ways and full lots then you should come and enjoy the music, food and people watching

photos.caption: What going to brunch looks like
Chicken Panini w/ jalapeño corn grits

comment.text: I finally was able to make it it Marlow's based on a suggestion from a friend. I really liked the set up and atmosphere with low lighting.  There are TVs everywhere which is a plus.  We weren't greeted when we walked and there was no one at the door so it was a little awkward standing and trying to figure out if it's seat yourself or what.  After we were greeted, they seated us quickly. They have many good choices on the menu that really had me torn! Shrimp and grits is usually a dish that I go to but I decided to do something different.  I went for the crab and shrimp nachos with parmesan truffle fries. I was very happy with my choice.  They aren't like the traditional nachos but rather similar to pizza bites just with seafood.  There was crab and shrimp on each one and the flavor was great! I loved the creamy sauce used. It's probably best to get it with a side because it probably won't fill you up by itself but it will taste good trying! Lol the truffle fries were okay. Kind of softer than I liked but seasoned well.  I was able to taste the shrimp and grits and I will definitely be getting that the next time around!

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Vincent,

Thanks so much for your thoughtful four star review. We are so glad you enjoyed your first visit to our tavern. Thank you for the compliments on the shrimp & crab nachos (as well as your taste of the shrimp & grits!). Thank you also for the feedback on the truffle fries. We certainly look forward to serving you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text:
Terrific dining option, with a combination of good service, a quality menu, and a nice setting.

Was staying at the nearby Renaissance Midtown, and the hotel staff highly recommended Marlow's as a solid option within walking distance. 

I was immediately greeted upon arriving, and after being seated after a short wait on a busy night, I had a superb dining experience.

My server, Rachel, recommended something off the dinner specials,  and I selected it - a grilled chicken dish with risotto, spinach, and squash. Enjoyed a tasty appetizer also, a hummus plate that was really good.

Solid dining option in the Midtown area!

photos.caption: Grilled chicken with risotto, squash & spinach. Great dinner special at Marlow's Midtown.

comment.text: Solid stop right by the condo we're staying in. The artichoke fondue was great, and the ahi tuna salad was delicious. Drinks were on the pricey side, but food and service were awesome.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Christin,

Thanks so much for the five star review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern. We so appreciate the compliments on the artichoke fondue and Ahi Tuna salad. We appreciate the feedback on the value of the drinks. Finally, thank you for the kind words on the service from our team. We certainly look forward to serving you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text: Great burger and crispy fries. What more can you want? The waitress was super nice also.

Milton is a phenomenal server. I will undoubtedly be back and when I'm back I hope he's my server again. Gave me a great recommendation for the fish tacos when they were out of tuna. Super kind guy and genuine human.

Stopped in for a drink and snack.  Interesting regular crowd...all I can say to be nice.    Bartender very friendly and attentive.  Beer glass, therefore beer, was ice cold.  I'll be back for food.   Menu looks great.  5 stars would be given if they happy hour menu.

Marlow's Tavern is one of the popular lunch places near my office mostly because of its proximity.  I've eaten here a few times, and it's OK.  With "OK" meaning, if there was a place that I liked better or I wanted to walk further than a block, I would go to that place.  

I've had many things on the menu but would only recommend the grilled chicken stack.  It's a substantial amount of protein with two chicken breasts but still doable in one sitting.  The chicken, squash, sun-dried tomato sauce, and olive oil all come together for a very tasty dish that is appropriate for lunch or dinner.  There is also a small bit of crumbled bacon in this dish, but not enough to make me swoon (I LOVE BACON), however it did add a nice bit of texture and flavor to the dish.

The only thing I would steer you away from are the fries.  They looked so delicious passing by that I ordered some as a side and they were tough and dry.  Looked gorgeous; tasted awful. 

Service is hit or miss; sometimes it's really good, sometimes it's OK and other times your server will disappear.  Cross your fingers and take your chances for a winner.  

The décor is a bummer.  All that black furniture is depressing and doesn't feel tavern-y to me. I can't imagine drinking a beer here.  I can't even imagine drinking a cocktail here, and I'm always open to vodka.  Also, they don't have happy hour drink specials; one of the bartenders told me that's because it's illegal to have happy hour drink specials in GA.  (I told him that several other restaurants were ignoring that rule completely because I've been to plenty of happy hours with $5 martinis and tequila shots.)

In conclusion, Marlow's is OK.  

Yelp 100 #32

I live across the street from Marlowe's, so I come here with some regularity.  I always sit at the bar - Benton and Parks are nice guys to chat with when you're there. 

I pretty much always order wings because I don't want too much else on the menu. The French Dip is really good; the toasts are fine.  I don't like the deconstructed shrimp and grits (the grit cake reads as polenta, which I don't love). 

The kitchen is unfussy - once I said I was craving buffalo mac, so they made me mac and cheese and put buffalo chicken strips on top.  Easy.  

Definitely an easy place to stop in for a drink and/or meal if you're in the area.  Also lots of TVs if you're into sports.

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Dione,

Thanks so much for your four star review. We are thrilled to have you as a regular! We agree that Benton and Parks are wonderful and will be sure to pass along your kind words. Thank you also for the compliments on the wings and French Dip. We certainly look forward to serving you again soon!

Cheers!

comment.text: Reasonably priced food in midtown Atlanta. I was quickly seated and given a menu and water. I had a wine from their selection organized by flavor, which was nice. I decided to try the asparagus fries and I'm so glad I did. I was worried a little about the tarragon in the aioli since it's not my favorite flavor but there was absolutely nothing bad about these. 10/10 wish I could get them at home. I followed it up with the black and blue steak salad. I think the steak was a little more on the medium rare side than medium but I tend to order warmer places cuz this happens a lot. I didn't get a pic of this cuz honestly it looked too good and I dove in. The pickled red onions are a great touch. Overall very pleased!

Great place for watching sport, the burger are sized really good, I loved the prices and the location, the staff was nice and great at telling me what to order and explaining everything even though I was sooo tired haha

owner_replies.comment:
Dear Khaled,

Thanks so much for your five star review! We are thrilled you enjoyed your visit to our tavern. Thank you for the compliments on your meal and the service from our team. We look forward to serving you again soon.

Cheers!

comment.text:
We are visiting from out of town, Marlow's has decent reviews and a nice sounding menu. Don't be fooled!
We ordered a two salads and waited an entire hour for said salads to arrive. Salads were old wilted lettuce greens unpeeled cucumbers, squishy tomatoes. Dressing was vacant of flavor and wait staff didn't really seem to care. However I did notice the men at the adjacent table had wonderful attentive service, food came before ours even though they arrived well after us. Their cooked meals miraculously took less time then a salad. So maybe if you are a white male this place might be okay.

owner_replies.comment: Dear Lisa, Your visit is certainly not the Marlow's way! We would like to speak in person about your experience. Please message us your preferred phone number and we will be in touch quickly. Thank you in advance for your time.

comment.text:
Went to Marlow's for lunch on a Saturday - decided to sit outside on a beautiful afternoon.  The waitress was delightful and promptly took our drink order and made some recommendations.  Wow!  She was spot on!!

We ordered the asparagus fries to start, light tempura asparagus served with a side of aioli.  Very tasty and the perfect size to share.  Since it was our first time at Marlow's the manager greeted us, and welcomed us to Marlow's with their signature starter the Kettle Chips - the chips were nice and crispy and dressed with bacon, tomatoes, and Gorgonzola!  Yum!

For the mains we went with 2 of the recs - the shrimp and grits and the Frisco Club - delicious!!  I had the Frisco Club paired with a Nice Small Salad -  just as the waitress stated, the flavors come together beautifully!  The portion was large and I took 1/2 of the sandwich in a box.  (BTW - me taking leftovers home says a lot about the food - I almost never do this, but the sandwich was so good I figured why not.  And later that day, the other half was just as good!)

We very much enjoyed the food, loved the friendly service, and will be back!

Came here for lunch yesterday. First time visitor. Sat at the bar along with with 8 or 9 other people from my class. The waiter Brandon was extremely polite and professional. He took everyone's order in a timely manner and ensured we had our drink order while we waited. The food came out very quickly and it was delicious!! I had the crab cake and truffle fries. The crab cake was not loaded with fillers it was all crab!! OMG the truffle fries are a must try. I will definitely be back to this restaurant.
